meanings.definition: Capable of being shown or proved
meanings.sent1: The experiment provided demonstrable evidence of the theory.
meanings.sent2: Her skills were demonstrable through her successful presentation.
meanings.sent3: It was quite demonstrable that the cat had stolen the cookie.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the storm was demonstrable in the flooded streets.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was demonstrable as she explained the lesson for the third time.

meanings.definition: Able to be demonstrated or proven
meanings.sent1: The results were clearly demonstrable in the data analysis.
meanings.sent2: His theory was demonstrable through the series of experiments.
meanings.sent3: It was demonstrable that the clown had a fear of heights.
meanings.sent4: The importance of family was demonstrable in her actions.
meanings.sent5: The joy on their faces was demonstrable as they won the game.
